citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The facility has not prepared a report of the semi-annual evaluations (facility inspection and program review) completed in
August 2022 and March 2023. The evaluation report is required to be prepared and submitted to the Institutional Official
to ensure that the Institutional Official and the facility are aware of the extent and nature of compliance and can ensure
compliance with the Animal Welfare Act. Correct by preparing an evaluation report for the March 2023 semi-annual
evaluations and all future semi-annual evaluations and submitting the report to the Institutional Official. Correct by
8/10/23.

The facility has a documented contingency plan but it primarily addresses emergencies from the human zoo visitor
standpoint. The plan is missing details related to to the specific tasks required to be carried out related to the animals
such as instructions and provisions for backup sources of food and water, sheltering in place versus evacuation of
animals, as well as husbandry requirements such as sanitation, ventilation, veterinary care etc. during the emergency.
Having a plan in place will help provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and care of their
animals in the event an emergency or disaster occurs. Correct by ensuring the written contingency plan includes all
required information. Correct by 8/31/23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the IACUC Chair.
